title: 1 . Fundamentals of Electrical Components and Circuits

subtitles.subtitle: 1.1 - Basic concept: Ohm´s law, voltage, current, power and energy, conducting/insulating materials, series and parallel circuits, star-delta conversions, Kirchhoff’s law, linear/non-linear, bilateral/unilateral, active/passive circuits.
1.2 - Network theorems: Superposition, Thevenin, Norton, Maximum power transfer, R-L, R-C, R-L-C, resonance in AC circuits, active/reactive power.
1.3 - Alternating current fundamentals: Generation, equations, waveforms, average, peak, RMS, three phase system.
1.4 - Electric circuit response (transient analysis): Steady state and transient of R-L, R-C, R-L-C circuits.
1.5 - Analysis of one-port and two-port networks: Transfer functions, poles/zeros, impedance/admittance, two-port parameters, interrelationships, series/parallel/cascade.
1.6 - Synthesis of one-port and two-port networks: Hurwitz polynomials, positive real functions, Foster/Cauer forms, RL/RC/LC networks, ladder networks.

title: 2 . Fundamentals of Electronic Devices and Circuits

subtitles.subtitle: 2.1 - Semiconductor diodes and transistors: PN junctions, diode characteristics, rectifiers, BJT, amplifier configurations, biasing.
2.2 - JFET and MOSFET: Construction, operation, characteristics, MOSFET types, CMOS, applications.
2.3 - Amplifiers and signal generators: Amplifier basics, classes, oscillators (RC, LC, crystal), waveform generators.
2.4 - Operational amplifier characterization: Differential amplifier, ideal/practical op-amp, inverting/non-inverting, followers, applications (integrator, differentiator, comparator).
2.5 - Nonlinear circuits and active filters: Log/antilog amplifiers, PLL, V-F/F-V converters, active filters.
2.6 - Logic families and ICs: Logic families, gates, DTL, RTL, TTL.
3.1 - Digital logic: Number systems, logic levels, gates, Boolean algebra, K-map.
3.2 - Combinational and arithmetic circuits: Multiplexers, demux, decoders, encoders, binary arithmetic.
3.3 - Sequential logic: Flip-flops, registers, counters.
3.4 - Microprocessor: Architecture, assembly programming.
3.5 - Interfacing: Memory, I/O, PPI, serial, USB, USART, DMA.
3.6 - Computer organization: CPU, control unit, ALU, instruction formats, addressing, RISC/CISC, pipelining.
4.1 - Introduction: Tokens, operators, input/output, structured/OOP, algorithms, flowcharts.
4.2 - Control statements: if, if-else, switch, loops, break.
4.3 - Functions: Prototypes, arguments, recursion.
4.4 - Pointers and files: Pointer arithmetic, arrays, dynamic memory, files.
4.5 - Arrays and structures: 1D/2D arrays, structures, pointers to structures.
4.6 - OOP features: Classes, objects, overloading, inheritance, polymorphism.
5.1 - Measurement and error: Static/dynamic errors, bridges.
5.2 - Transducers, sensors and signal conditioning: Types, LVDT, strain gauges, thermal, photo, DAC/ADC.
5.3 - Electrical measurements and instruments: PMMC, voltmeter, ammeter, wattmeter, meters, CT/PT, megger.
5.4 - System modeling: Mechanical, electrical, thermal, liquid systems, analogous models.
5.5 - Block diagram representation: Reduction, signal flow graphs, responses.
5.6 - Stability analysis: Routh, root locus, frequency response, Nyquist, Bode, margins.
6.1 - Transformers fundamentals: Types, operation, EMF, equivalent circuit, losses, efficiency, tests, autotransformers.
6.2 - DC generators: Principles, construction, winding, losses, parallel operation.
6.3 - DC motors: Principles, types, speed control, braking, brushless DC.
6.4 - Induction motors: Operation, construction, equivalent circuit, torque-speed, speed control, applications.
6.5 - Synchronous generators: Construction, windings, EMF, regulation, synchronization.
6.6 - Synchronous motors: Principles, torque-angle, starting, excitation, power factor improvement.

title: 7 . Signals, Systems and Frequency Domain Analysis

subtitles.subtitle: 7.1 - Fundamentals: Signal classification, operations, LTI systems, convolution.
7.2 - Laplace transforms: Definition, properties, solving DEs, transfer function.
7.3 - Fourier series and transforms: Continuous/discrete time, properties, DTFT.
7.4 - Z-transform and digital systems: Sampling, z-transform, stability, FFT.
7.5 - Applications: Stability, spectral analysis, correlation, system design.
7.6 - Filters: Types, active/passive, FIR/IIR, Butterworth, Chebyshev.
8.1 - Basic elements: Analog/digital systems, noise, SNR, BER, AWGN.
8.2 - Analog modulation/demodulation: AM, DSB-SC, SSB, VSB, FM, PM.
8.3 - Digital communication: ASK, FSK, PSK, QPSK, QAM, PCM, Shannon.
8.4 - Pulse modulation and coding: PAM, PCM, DPCM, DM, sigma-delta.
8.5 - Error control coding: Hamming, parity, block codes, cyclic, convolution codes.
8.6 - Data communication: Multiplexing (FDM, TDM, WDM), topologies, OSI/TCP-IP.
9.1 - Power plant: Thermal, hydro, nuclear, solar, wind, tidal, geothermal, fuel cells, storage.
9.2 - Transmission/distribution: Systems, voltage choice, conductors, insulators, corona, distribution classification.
9.3 - Protection/control: Fuses, breakers, relays, protection schemes, SCADA, EMS, smart grid.
9.4 - Residential/industrial electrification: Wiring, load estimation, tariffs, conservation.
9.5 - Power electronics: Thyristors, SCR, triac, UPS, SMPS, converters, inverters.
9.6 - Power system analysis: Fault, load flow, stability.
10.1 - Engineering drawings: Sheets, dimensions, projections.
10.2 - Engineering Economics: Cash flow, NPV, IRR, depreciation, taxation.
10.3 - Project planning and scheduling: Life cycle, CPM, PERT, leveling.
10.4 - Project management: Info systems, risk, financing, tender, contract.
10.5 - Professional practice: Ethics, environment, safety, NEA roles.
10.6 - Engineering Regulatory Body: Nepal Engineering Council Acts & Regulations.
